results.title: Christmas
results.brief_description: A special program for Christmas featuring children from Ivanhoe East Primary School. The program covers the making of Christmas decorations for the tree, making the traditional Christmas sweet, “White Christmas”, followed by a Christmas story and Christmas carols.

results.title: Christmas
results.brief_description: Adapted from Chapter 7 of the book “More about Paddington” by Michael Bond. For Paddington’s first Christmas with the Brown’s, he receives a chemistry set, a scrapbook and a xylophone. By 6 o’clock Christmas morning he is proudly banging out the National Anthem for everyone to hear. Paddington has never eaten a meal like Mrs Brown’s Christmas dinner, but what an eventful dinner it turns out to be. Animated by Ivor Wood and told by Michael Hordern. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Christine Truman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
Shows Christine Truman in some 21 matches which have brought her to the top rank of British lawn tennis; including her victorious match at Wimbledon against Dorothy Knode and the 1960 Wightman games. Shows something of the unremitting practice which has developed her style of play and stamina, and also includes scenes of her home life.

results.title: Christine [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Polar Film, Columbia Pictures, Richard Kobritz and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: Christine, a fire-engine red, 1958 Plymouth Fury that is possessed by the malevolent spirit of its long-dead owner is the woman of the title. She is jealous of anyone who tries to steal her owners’ attention. She was born in Detroit on an automobile assembly line but she is no ordinary automobile. Deep within her chassis lurks the devil incarnate and she is filled with a chilling, insatiable vengeance that will destroy anyone in her path. She seduces 17-year-old Arnie Cunningham who becomes consumed with passion for her sleek, rounded chrome-laden body. She demands his absolute and unquestioned devotion and when outsiders seek to interfere, they become victims of Christine’s uncontrollable wrath. Cast includes Keith Gordon, John Stockwell, Alexandra Paul, Robert Prosky and Harry Dean Stanton. Screenplay by Bill Phillips, based on the novel by Stephen King.

results.title: Christina Stead
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
In the only filmed interview with one of Australia’s most popular and respected novelists, Christina Stead is both challenging and revealing.

results.title: Christianity: the way of goodness and mercy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Religions of the world”.
Christianity is a religion which has more followers than any other. Jesus Christ is the central figure of worship and his life, deeds and teachings had a profound effect on human history. Shot in various locations, the program discusses everything from the Sermon on the Mount to the Dead Sea Scrolls.

results.title: Christian Boltanski
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
A comprehensive documentary on one of the most important contemporary artists of 20th Century France, Christian Boltanski. Interviewed by Melvyn Bragg, Boltanski’s childhood influences, mostly the affects of the Holocaust on society in post-war France are explored in direct reference to a series of Boltanski’s work spanning over a period of 30 years. Boltanski’s passion for ethnology, collections and death, as themes central to his art, are discussed in relationship to his work. The subtlety of broad themes are constantly explored in his work: the nature of the killer, heroes and villains, quantifying loss. Boltanski uses mostly photographs in his installation pieces. Works featured in the documentary: ‘Shadows’ (1985); ‘Sans Souci’ (1991); ‘The Reserves’ (1993); ‘The Dead Swiss’; ‘The Art of the Venice Biennale 1938’ (1993); ‘Comical Skits’(1974).

results.title: Christ stopped at Eboli = Cristo si e' fermato a Eboli
results.creator_credit: Radiotelevisione Italiana, TV2, VIDES Cinematografica, Franco Cristaldi, Nicola Carraro and Francesco Rosi
results.brief_description: This four part mini-series (which was also released as a feature film in a condensed form) is based on the autobiography of Carlo Levi, writer, painter, doctor and avowed anti-fascist. In 1935 Levi was exiled to Lucania in the extreme south of Italy for his political activities. In this remote peasant land so cut off from the domain of history that even Christ never arrived, so the locals say, Levi discovered a way of life which transformed him. He felt more strongly the weight of age-old injustices and went back to the roots of these injustices. ‘This film is a journey through my own conscience and through that of all men who carry a Lucania in themselves’ (Rosi). Cast includes: Gian Maria Volonte, Paolo Bonacelli, Alain Cuny, Irene Papas. Written by Francesco Rosi, Tonino Guerra, Raffaele la Capria ; photography, Pasqualino De Santis ; music, Piero Piccioni. Italian dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Christ Is Risen
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, William Canning and Colin Low
results.brief_description: Focuses on the Easter service in the Russian Orthodox Church of St Peter and St Paul in Montreal. The depth of the emotion touched by this ancient ceremony is reflected in the film. Filmed in a shadowy, taper-lit space, sonorous with chanting voices, and coloured with occasional views of icons and frescos, the film shows an absorbing religious experience.
